dt: {bc}a late 19th century to early 20th century American school of psychology concerned especially with how the mind {a_link|functions} to adapt the individual to the environment {dx}compare {dxt|structuralism||1}{/dx}
{bc}a philosophy of design (as in architecture) holding that form should be adapted to use, material, and structure
{bc}a theory that stresses the interdependence of the patterns and institutions of a society and their interaction in maintaining cultural and social unity
{bc}a doctrine or practice that emphasizes practical utility or {a_link|functional} relations

shortdef: a late 19th century to early 20th century American school of psychology concerned especially with how the mind functions to adapt the individual to the environment
a philosophy of design (as in architecture) holding that form should be adapted to use, material, and structure
a theory that stresses the interdependence of the patterns and institutions of a society and their interaction in maintaining cultural and social unity
